translated: “I gave half a robe to the Fortunate One,
and half a cloth to the Community;
I was given the highest praise,
and I was united with a good destination.
for an eon I rejoiced in heaven;
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of giving cloth.
there were twenty-eight kings who were Universal Monarchs,
I have done what the Buddha said”.🔽Thus the elder Aḍḍhaceḷaka recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā aḍḍhaceḷako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Aḍḍhaceḷakattherassāpadānaṁ tatiyaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmai aḍḍhaceḷakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽aḍḍhaceḷaka therassa apadānam
translated: The Elder Aḍḍhaceḷaka’s Birth Story, the third.
